title: Barbarian
content: The barbarian is a playable character class in the Dungeons & Dragons (D&D) fantasy role-playing game. This fictional class of characters first appeared in the 3.5 edition of D&D and was introduced in the Player's Handbook. The barbarian is a class that is designed to be a master of combat, with a focus on brute strength and physical prowess. title: Classes
content: The classes in Dungeons & Dragons are the different types of characters that players can choose to play as. Each class has its own unique abilities and skills, and players can choose to play as a single class or multiclass to combine the abilities of two or more classes. There are currently 13 classes in Dungeons & Dragons, each with its own unique abilities and skills. title: Dungeon Masters
content: The Dungeon Master (DM) is the person who runs the game and acts as the referee, storyteller, and world-builder. The DM is responsible for creating the world in which the game takes place, as well as controlling the non-player characters (NPCs) that the players interact with. The DM is also responsible for setting the scene, describing the environment, and narrating the story. The DM is the ultimate authority in the game and is responsible for making sure that the rules are followed and that the game runs smoothly. The DM is the ultimate authority in the game and is responsible for making sure that the rules are followed and that the game runs smoothly.
